p: Then, several conjugates were obtained by varying the content of the attached peptide. Some of the resulting derivatives exhibited enhanced antimicrobial activity against S. aureus, E. faecalis, E. coli, and P. aeruginosa bacteria compared to anoplin or chitosan. In particular, the conjugates were very effective against E. coli, with MIC values as low as 4 Î¼g/mL. More importantly, the hemotoxicity was significantly reduced in the case of the anoplin-chitosan derivatives.
